article:
Events and trends
* 677 BCâEsarhaddon leads the Assyrian army against rebellious Arab tribes,
  advances as far as the Brook of Egypt.
* 676 BCâZhou Hui Wang becomes King of the Zhou Dynasty of China.
* 676 BC- Chalcedon became a Greek city.
* 675 BCâEsarhaddon begins the rebuilding of Babylon
* 674 BCâEsarhaddon puts down a revolt in Ashkelon supported by Taharqa, king of
  Egypt. In response, the Assyrians invade Egypt, but Taharqa is able to hold
  the invaders off.
* 673 BCâTullus Hostilius becomes the third King of Rome.
* 671 BCâEsarhaddon again invades Egypt, capturing Memphis as well as a number
  of the royal family.

Significant people
* Esarhaddon, King of Assyria and conqueror of Egypt (reigned 681â669 BC)
* Argaeus I, who acceded to the kingship of Macedon with his father's death; he
  reigned from circa 678 BC to circa 640 BC

Deaths
* 678 BCâapproximate date of death of Perdiccas I, king of Macedon
* 673 BCâNuma Pompilius, second of the Kings of Rome, successor to Romulus
* 670 BCâMettius Fufetius, latin king of Alba Longa
